praveenbingo commented on pull request #5902: ARROW-7262 : [C++][Gandiva] Added replace function
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5902#discussion_r350665926
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/gandiva/precompiled/string_ops.cc
 ##########
 @@ -410,4 +410,45 @@ const char* convert_fromUTF8_binary(int64 context, const char* bin_in, int32 len
   return ret;
 }
 
+FORCE_INLINE
+const char* replace_utf8_utf8_utf8(int64 context, const char* text, int32 text_len,
+                                   const char* from_str, int32 from_str_len,
+                                   const char* to_str, int32 to_str_len, int32* out_len) {
+  // if from_str is empty or its length exceeds that of original string,
+  // return the original string
+  if (from_str_len == 0 || from_str_len > text_len) {
+    *out_len = text_len;
+    return text;
+  }
+
+  char* out = reinterpret_cast<char*>(gdv_fn_context_arena_malloc(context, 8000));
 
 Review comment:
   why 8000? should this not be at the maximum text len..
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5902#discussion_r351169549
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/gandiva/precompiled/string_ops.cc
 ##########
 @@ -410,4 +410,45 @@ const char* convert_fromUTF8_binary(int64 context, const char* bin_in, int32 len
   return ret;
 }
 
+FORCE_INLINE
+const char* replace_utf8_utf8_utf8(int64 context, const char* text, int32 text_len,
+                                   const char* from_str, int32 from_str_len,
+                                   const char* to_str, int32 to_str_len, int32* out_len) {
+  // if from_str is empty or its length exceeds that of original string,
+  // return the original string
+  if (from_str_len == 0 || from_str_len > text_len) {
+    *out_len = text_len;
+    return text;
+  }
+
+  char* out = reinterpret_cast<char*>(gdv_fn_context_arena_malloc(context, 8000));
 
 Review comment:
   you potentially might want to avoid the malloc until you actually find the match below, then do a memcpy for all elements before the match is found.

 ##########

   return ret;
 }
 
+FORCE_INLINE
+const char* replace_utf8_utf8_utf8(int64 context, const char* text, int32 text_len,
 
 Review comment:
   can we break this into two functions - one that accepts a max length as input and this one that just wraps the other one by passing in the max length..
   
   that way we can test the inner function for max length errors too..
